summary.para: Creates a font face instance with specific axis values.

param.name: fontSimulations
param.para: Font face simulation flags for algorithmic emboldening and italicization.

param.name: fontAxisValues
param.para: A pointer to an array containing a list of font axis values. The array should be the size (the number of elements) indicated by the fontAxisValueCount argument.

param.name: fontAxisValueCount
param.para: The number of font axis values contained in the fontAxisValues array.

param.name: fontFace
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font face object, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |DWRITE_E_REMOTEFONT|The font is not local.|

remarks.para: The axis values that you provide are permitted to be a subset or superset of all the ones actually supported by the font. Any unspecified axes use their default values: values beyond the ranges are clamped, and any non-varying axes have no effect.

summary.para: Creates a font face reference with specific axis values.

param.name: fontSimulations
param.para: Font face simulation flags for algorithmic emboldening and italicization.

param.name: fontAxisValues
param.para: A pointer to an array containing a list of font axis values. The array should be the size (the number of elements) indicated by the fontAxisValueCount argument.

param.name: fontAxisValueCount
param.para: The number of font axis values contained in the fontAxisValues array.

param.name: fontFaceReference
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created font face reference object, otherwise it sets the pointer to nullptr.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

remarks.para: The axis values that you provide are permitted to be a subset or superset of all the ones actually supported by the font. Any unspecified axes use their default values: values beyond the ranges are clamped, and any non-varying axes have no effect.

summary.para: Retrieves the localized names of a font axis.

param.name: names
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created localized strings object.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

remarks.para: The font author may not have supplied names for some font axes. The localized strings will be empty in that case.

summary.para: Retrieves the number of named values for a specific axis.

returns.para: Type: UINT32
The number of named values for the axis specified by axisIndex.

summary.para: Retrieves the localized names of specific values for a font axis.

param.name: names
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to a newly created localized strings object.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

remarks.para: The font author may not have supplied names for some font axis values. The localized strings will be empty in that case. The range may be a single point, where minValue == maxValue. All ranges are in ascending order by axisValueIndex.

summary.para: Retrieves the default values for all axes supported by the font resource.

param.name: fontAxisValues
param.para: A pointer to an array of DWRITE_FONT_AXIS_VALUE structures into which GetDefaultFontAxisValues writes the list of font axis values. You're responsible for managing the size and the lifetime of this array. Call to determine the size of array to allocate.

param.name: fontAxisValueCount
param.para: The maximum number of font axis values to write into the memory block pointed to by fontAxisValues.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_INVALIDARG|fontAxisValueCount doesn't match the value returned by GetFontAxisCount.|

remarks.para: Different font resources may have different defaults. For OpenType 1.8 fonts, these values come from the STAT and fvar tables. For older fonts without a STAT table, weight-width-slant-italic are read from the OS/2 table.

summary.para: Retrieves attributes describing the given axis, such as whether the font author recommends to hide the axis in user interfaces.

returns.para: Type:
The attributes for the given axis, or DWRITE_FONT_AXIS_ATTRIBUTES_NONE if axisIndex is beyond the font count.

summary.para: Retrieves the number of axes supported by the font resource. This includes both static and variable axes (see ).

returns.para: Type: UINT32
The number of axes defined by the font face.

summary.para: Retrieves the value ranges of each axis.

param.name: fontAxisRanges
param.para: A pointer to an array of DWRITE_FONT_AXIS_RANGE structures into which GetFontAxisRanges writes the list of font axis value ranges. You're responsible for managing the size and the lifetime of this array. Call to determine the size of array to allocate.

param.name: fontAxisRangeCount
param.para: The maximum number of font axis value ranges to write into the memory block pointed to by fontAxisRanges.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| |E_INVALIDARG|fontAxisValueCount doesn't match the value returned by GetFontAxisCount.|

remarks.para: A non-varying axis has an empty range (minValue == maxValue).

summary.para: Retrieves the zero-based index of the font face within its font file. If the font file contains a single face, then the return value is zero.

returns.para: Type: UINT32
The zero-based index of the font face within its font file.

summary.para: Retrieves the font file of the resource.

param.name: fontFile
param.para: The address of a pointer to an interface. On successful completion, the function sets the pointer to the font file object.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.

summary.para: Determines whether this font face's resource supports any variable axes. When true, at least one in the font resource has a non-empty range (maxValue > minValue).

returns.para: Type: BOOL
true if the font face's resource supports any variable axes. Otherwise, false.

summary.para: Provides axis information for a font resource, and is used to create specific font face instances.
